onAttachedToWindow().Description: Called when the window has been attached to the window manager. See @B_android#view#View#onAttachedToWindow_E@ for more information.

setVolumeControlEnabled(boolean).Description: Sets whether to enable the volume slider and volume control using the volume keys when the route supports it. The default value is true.

isVolumeControlEnabled().Description: Returns whether to enable the volume slider and volume control using the volume keys when the route supports it.

getRoute().Description: Gets the route that this dialog is controlling.

Returns: The media control view, or null if none.
Parameters: Bundle: The dialog's saved instance state.
onCreateMediaControlView(android.os.Bund.Description: Provides the subclass an opportunity to create a view that will replace the default media controls for the currently playing content.

Returns: If you handled the event, return true. If you want to allow the event to be handled by the next receiver, return false.
Parameters: KeyEvent: Description of the key event.
onKeyUp(int, android.view.KeyEvent).Description: A key was released. The default implementation handles KEYCODE_BACK to close the dialog.

Returns: If you handled the event, return true. If you want to allow the event to be handled by the next receiver, return false.
Parameters: KeyEvent: Description of the key event.
onKeyDown(int, android.view.KeyEvent).Description: A key was pressed down. If the focused view didn't want this event, this method is called. The default implementation consumed the KEYCODE_BACK to later handle it in @B_android#app#Dialog#onKeyUp_E@.

Returns: The media control view, or null if none.
getMediaControlView().Description: Gets the media control view that was created by @B_android#support#v7#app#MediaRouteControllerDialog#onCreateMediaControlView_E@.

onDetachedFromWindow().Description: Called when the window has been attached to the window manager. See @B_android#view#View#onDetachedFromWindow_E@ for more information.

Returns: The token for the session to use or null if none.
getMediaSession().Description: Gets the session to use for metadata and transport controls.

Parameters: Bundle: If this dialog is being reinitialized after a the hosting activity was previously shut down, holds the result from the most recent call to @B_android#app#Dialog#onSaveInstanceState_E@, or null if this is the first time.
onCreate(android.os.Bundle).Description: Similar to @B_android#app#Activity#onCreate_E@, you should initialize your dialog in this method, including calling @B_android#app#Dialog#setContentView_E@.

ClassDesc: This class implements the route controller dialog for @B_android#support#v7#media#MediaRouter_E@. This dialog allows the user to control or disconnect from the currently selected route.
